Back to Franz Schubert

Franz Schubert

Twelve Ecossaises, D 299

1815

[IMSLP]

Total duration: 7' 30"

  • 1. A-flat major
  • 2. E-flat major
  • 3. E major
  • 4. A major
  • 5. D-flat major
  • 6. A-flat major
  • 7. E major
  • 8. C major
  • 9. F major
  • 10. B-flat major
  • 11. A-flat major
  • 12. F minor

Recommended editions

  • Neue Schubert-Ausgabe (Bärenreiter) · VII/2/6 · BA 5529 · Tänze I · ed. Walburga Litschauer
  • Henle · HN 74 · Sämtliche Tänze / Band I · ed. Paul Mies
  • Wiener Urtext · UT 50022 · Sämtliche Tänze für Klavier / Band 2 · ed. Alexander Weinmann

1. A-flat major

A version of this dance is also used as the first ecossaise of the twelve waltzes, seventeen Ländler and nine ecossaises (D 145).

Duration: 0' 30"

Difficulty: 2

2. E-flat major

This dance is followed by a da capo repetition of no. 1.

Duration: 0' 30"

Difficulty: 2

3. E major

Duration: 0' 30"

Difficulty: 2

4. A major

This dance is followed by a da capo repetition of no. 3.

Duration: 0' 30"

Difficulty: 1.5

5. D-flat major

Duration: 0' 30"

Difficulty: 2

6. A-flat major

This dance is followed by a da capo repetition of no. 5.

Duration: 0' 30"

Difficulty: 2

7. E major

Duration: 0' 30"

Difficulty: 1.5

8. C major

This dance is followed by a da capo repetition of no. 7.

Duration: 0' 30"

Difficulty: 1.5

9. F major

Duration: 0' 30"

Difficulty: 1.5

10. B-flat major

This dance is followed by a da capo repetition of no. 9.

Duration: 0' 30"

Difficulty: 2

11. A-flat major

Duration: 0' 30"

Difficulty: 1.5

12. F minor

This dance is followed by a da capo repetition of no. 11.

Duration: 0' 30"

Difficulty: 2
